intro: Uragoga elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic uragoga, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
